text: The Independent Republicans (, RI) were a liberal-conservative political group in France founded in 1962. It became a political party in 1966 known as the National Federation of the Independent Republicans (Fédération nationale des républicains et indépendants, FNRI). Its leader was Valéry Giscard d'Estaing. In 1977 it became the Republican Party which joined the Union for French Democracy (UDF) the following year. ==References== Category:1960s establishments in France Category:1962 establishments in Europe Category:Valéry Giscard d'Estaing Category:Political parties in France
title: Independent Republicans
